StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NCI Lung Cancer and Smoking Phenotypes in African-American Subjects

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) Study of Lung Cancer and Smoking Phenotypes in African-American Subjects was funded in whole or in part with federal funds from the NCI, US National Institutes of Health (NIH). A full list of acknowledgments for each participating study is provided in the manuscript (Zanetti K, et al, Lung Cancer, 2016. PMID: 27393504). The datasets have been accessed through the NIH database for Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP). If these dataset(s) were used, please cite manuscripts (Zanetti K, et al, Lung Cancer, 2016. PMID: 27393504) in all oral or written presentations, disclosures, or publication.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer, PUB, NPU, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CA-PUB-NPU-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Cancer and related disorders. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CA-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CA
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Cancer.

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

StudyTo.name: dbGaP Collection: Compilation of Individual-Level Genomic Data for General Research Use
